                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                       org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)

        Parameters:
        section - Section to get item from
        path - Specified path after section
        player - Player to parse the items with (for %player% and other placeholders)
        Returns:
        Parsed ItemStack

        Returns:
        the amount of exp the Player has
        See Also:
        http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Experience#Leveling_up

      • getExpFromLevel

        public static int getExpFromLevel(int level)
        Calculates total experience based on level.
        Parameters:
        level - the level
        Returns:
        the total experience calculated
        See Also:
        "One can determine how much experience has been collected to reach a level using the equations: Total Experience = [Level]2 + 6[Level] (at levels 0-15) 2.5[Level]2 - 40.5[Level] + 360 (at levels 16-30) 4.5[Level]2 - 162.5[Level] + 2220 (at level 31+)"

      • getLevelFromExp

        public static double getLevelFromExp(long exp)
        Calculates level based on total experience.
        Parameters:
        exp - the total experience
        Returns:
        the level calculated

      • getExpToNext

        private static int getExpToNext(int level)
        See Also:
        "The formulas for figuring out how many experience orbs you need to get to the next level are as follows: Experience Required = 2[Current Level] + 7 (at levels 0-15) 5[Current Level] - 38 (at levels 16-30) 9[Current Level] - 158 (at level 31+)"

      • changeExp

        public static void changeExp(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                             int exp)
        Change a Player's exp.

        This method should be used in place of Player.giveExp(int), which does not properly account for different levels requiring different amounts of experience.

        Parameters:
        player - the Player affected
        exp - the amount of experience to add or remove

      • outdated

        public static boolean outdated(java.lang.String oldVer,
                               java.lang.String newVer)
        Used to compare plugin versions Supports any amount of decimals, however no letters/symbols if oldVer is < newVer, both versions can only have numbers and .'s Outputs: 5.5, 10.3 | true 2.3.1, 3.1.4.6 | true 1.2, 1.1 | false
